trial_identification.studytitle: Repeat percutaneous facet joint denervation for chronic back pain: a prospective study for improvement in low back outcome score.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Repeat percutaneous facet joint denervation for chronic back pain: a prospective study for improvement in low back outcome score.

interventions.interventions: Repeat Percutaneous radiofrequency facet joint denervation (neurotomy) - This involves lesioning via use of percutaneous electrodes of selected pain-producing lumbar medial branches percutaneously using radiofrequency with pulsed time cycle of 2Ã—2 msec/second and maximum probe tip temperature of 90 degrees celsius. In this trial a single group will recieve a procedure and then a 12 month followup
interventions.comparator: Same group (i.e. subjects acting as their own control via their preoperative LBOS) but using baseline low back outcome scores before repeat radiofrequency facet joint denervation. The technique used for previous RFJD procedures done on this group used an identical radiofrequency technique and radiofrequency settings that will be done prospectively upon the same group (i.e. the same procedure is being repeated in the same group.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Low back outcome score (Validated pain score: Greenough CG Fraser RD. Assessment of outcome in patients with low-back pain. Spine. 1992;17:36-41 )

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patient satisfaction as measured by survey

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Previous success with facet joint denervation
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unsuccessful primary procedure Unwillingness to participate

trial_design.designfeatures: Prospective Cohort study following subjects before and after a repeat facet joint denervation for chronic low back pain; The subjects will be consented to participate before recieving the treatment which they will recieve irrespective of their participation in the study or not (all participants will recieve the same intervention)

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: 12 Walter St North Adelaide South Australia (SA) 5006

ethicsAndSummary.summary: 'Repeat percutaneous facet joint denervation for chronic back pain: a prospective study for improvement in low back outcome score - this study will involve between 65-75 participants who have had an initially successful facet joint denervation and will follow them prospectively as to the success, as judged by the LBOS, with their repeat procedure.
